intro: Pleomele sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak pleomele, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Agavaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are thick and succulent. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
